alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 07 at 1:36PM CST until December 09 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Flint Creek near Kansas affecting Cherokee and Delaware Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Flint Creek near Kansas. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flint Creek threatens individual campsites and becomes dangerous for recreational floating. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon, which is below flood stage but above action stage. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
